apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: The standard DisplayObject. This is modelled after the Flash DisplayObject and can be used in very similar way. Each DisplayObject will by default create a corresponding HTML DIV element. When extending DisplayObject you can change what type of HTML element gets created by setting the mElementType before calling the super() in the constructor.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Add a DisplayObject as a child to this DisplayObject at a certain position.

apiParam.apiDesc: The position to add the child at

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Add a DisplayObject as a child to this DisplayObject at a certain position. If you have not touched the z-index this influences the draw order. Also automatically sets the child's parent to this.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Add a DisplayObject as a child to this DisplayObject.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Add a DisplayObject as a child to this DisplayObject. Automatically sets the child's parent to this.
The opacity

apiOperation.shortdesc: A reference to the root Application object if we can find it.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: A reference to the root Application object if we can find it. If not will return null
The bottom position

apiOperation.shortdesc: Return the child at the given index

apiReturn.apiDesc: The DisplayObject at the given index

apiParam.apiDesc: The index at which to find the child

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Return the child at the given index
The height
The DisplayObject's HTMLElement

apiOperation.shortdesc: The number of children this DisplayObject has

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: The number of children this DisplayObject has
The current instance's parent DisplayObject
The height as a percentage
The width as a percentage
The right position
The scaleX. Only provided for compatibility with Flash. ScaleX will always return 1 and setting it will be ignored.
The scaleY. Only provided for compatibility with Flash. ScaleY will always return 1 and setting it will be ignored.

apiOperation.shortdesc: A reference to the Stage object if we can find it.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: A reference to the Stage object if we can find it. If not will return null
The unscaledHeight
The unscaledWidth
The visibility
The width
The x position (left)
The y position (top)
The z-index

apiOperation.shortdesc: Remove a the child DisplayObject at the given index from this DisplayObject

apiParam.apiDesc: The index at which to remove the child

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Remove a the child DisplayObject at the given index from this DisplayObject

apiOperation.shortdesc: Remove a child DisplayObject from this DisplayObject

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Remove a child DisplayObject from this DisplayObject
The opacity
The bottom position
The height
Set the parent element. This is called from within addChild.
The height as a percentage
The width as a percentage
The right position
The scaleX. Only provided for compatibility with Flash. ScaleX will always return 1 and setting it will be ignored.
The scaleY. Only provided for compatibility with Flash. ScaleY will always return 1 and setting it will be ignored.
The visibility
The width
The x position (left)
The y position (top)
The z-index

apiClassifier.shortdesc: A simple bitmap class which loads and displays an image from a URL This class is wrapped by the Loader class which will give you a bit more feedback about how the loading is going, and as a final result will return a Bitmap object.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: A simple bitmap class which loads and displays an image from a URL This class is wrapped by the Loader class which will give you a bit more feedback about how the loading is going, and as a final result will return a Bitmap object.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Return a copy of the Bitmap with the same contents

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Return a copy of the Bitmap with the same contents

apiOperation.shortdesc: The source URL of the bitmap.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: The source URL of the bitmap.

apiOperation.shortdesc: The unscaled height of the bitmap.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: The unscaled height of the bitmap.

apiOperation.shortdesc: The unscaled width of the bitmap.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: The unscaled width of the bitmap.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Called when loading of the bitmap has completed

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Called when loading of the bitmap has completed

apiOperation.shortdesc: The source URL of the bitmap.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: The source URL of the bitmap.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: A simple loader class that can manage loading Bitmap and Video instances.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: A simple loader class that can manage loading Bitmap and Video instances. Note that the Video class isn't well supported yet since there are still numerous issues with video on various mobile devices, so YMMV.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Close the loader before finishing loading.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Close the loader before finishing loading. Cleans up any event listeners and removes the content if it already existed.

apiOperation.shortdesc: If loading was complete returns the loaded content

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: If loading was complete returns the loaded content

apiOperation.shortdesc: Load an ISrcDisplayObject from the requested URL

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Load an ISrcDisplayObject from the requested URL

apiOperation.shortdesc: Handle load completion and send the appropriate events.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Handle load completion and send the appropriate events.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Unload the current content and close the loader

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Unload the current content and close the loader

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: A simple horizontal layout component. Uses float:left on it's children's HTML elements to layout the elements. Also serves as an example of how to modify addChild and removeChild to provide different layout behavior.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Add child to the container. Modifies the HTML element's CSS to float:left to create a horizontal layout

apiClassifier.shortdesc: A simple DisplayObject that provides a Canvas and 2D context.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: A simple DisplayObject that provides a Canvas and 2D context.

apiOperation.shortdesc: The 2D drawing context for this canvas

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: The 2D drawing context for this canvas

apiOperation.shortdesc: Set the height of the Canvas drawing area

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Set the height of the Canvas drawing area

apiOperation.shortdesc: Set the width of the Canvas drawing area

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Set the width of the Canvas drawing area

apiClassifier.shortdesc: A class that functionally simulates the Flash stage.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: A class that functionally simulates the Flash stage. It provides an EnterFrame timer loop which can be used for animation, and allows you to control framerate

apiOperation.shortdesc: To make sure the frame loop doesn't cost more overhead than strictly needed we cache whether there are actually any listeners for ENTER_FRAME, otherwise we skip all kinds of processing.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: To make sure the frame loop doesn't cost more overhead than strictly needed we cache whether there are actually any listeners for ENTER_FRAME, otherwise we skip all kinds of processing.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Process the current frame, and dispatch ENTER_FRAME events if needed

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Process the current frame, and dispatch ENTER_FRAME events if needed
The current framerate

apiOperation.shortdesc: Get's access to the application stage object

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Get's access to the application stage object

apiOperation.shortdesc: Every DisplayObject has a stage, and Stage inherits from DisplayObject so this returns itself.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Every DisplayObject has a stage, and Stage inherits from DisplayObject so this returns itself.

apiOperation.shortdesc: To make sure the frame loop doesn't cost more overhead than strictly needed we cache whether there are actually any listeners for ENTER_FRAME, otherwise we skip all kinds of processing.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: To make sure the frame loop doesn't cost more overhead than strictly needed we cache whether there are actually any listeners for ENTER_FRAME, otherwise we skip all kinds of processing.
The current framerate

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Interface for any DisplayObject that can have its source set.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: Interface for any DisplayObject that can have its source set. This is used by the Loader class to describe its return type

apiClassifier.shortdesc: A simple Video class which deals with some of the weird issues with HTML5 video.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
A simple Video class which deals with some of the weird issues with HTML5 video. This already supports a few different platforms and situations however you still have to determine whether to load an MP4 or WEBM using the Capabilities class first.
Note there are still numerous issues with various mobile browsers which have varying degrees of support for HTML5.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Return a copy of the Video with the same contents

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Return a copy of the Video with the same contents
The current playhead time
The duration
Whether the video is loaded

apiOperation.shortdesc: The source URL of the video.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: The source URL of the video.
The original video height
The original video width

apiOperation.shortdesc: An eventloop which notifies listeners of changes in the timestamp of the video or when playback has ended (when the end of the video has been reached).

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: An eventloop which notifies listeners of changes in the timestamp of the video or when playback has ended (when the end of the video has been reached).

apiOperation.shortdesc: Handle when loading of the video is complete

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Handle when loading of the video is complete
Pause video playback

apiOperation.shortdesc: The source URL of the video.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: The source URL of the video.
